Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Theromacin (UCSS1a; natural AMPs; annelid, metazoa; animals; 5S=S; ZZT)
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: Disulfide bond is critical for activity.

Literature Information.Literature: Different from hydramacin-1 and neuromacin, it contains a fifth disulfide bond.  Active against M. luteus (MIC 16.5–33 nM).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. Updated 2/2014; 10/2016.
Literature Information.Author: Tasiemski A, Vandenbulcke F, Mitta G, Lemoine J, Lefebvre C, Sautière PE, Salzet M.2004
Literature Information.Title: Molecular characterization of two novel antibacterial peptides inducible upon bacterial challenge in an annelid, the leech Theromyzon tessulatum
